title: Faux-exotic, pseudo-calligraphic thing
content:
![Uniquely Singapore](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111120558im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32165.gif)   
   
It's likely to be handdrawn, but there's also a high chance that it is a freeware something, or even a commercial font, which I hope someone can point out.   
   
If it's handdrawn, I'm interested to know if there are any fonts out there which this could be based on.   
   
The sans that they have chosen is Shinn Medium.   
   
Any kind of pointers / comments would be appreciated. Thanks guys.
author: karen

comments.content:
It's a toughie huh? I can't believe they rebranded the country without using proper lettering.   
   
The Minnesota typefaces were nice. Saw them in _How_. But maybe it's not fair to compare since that exercise was focused on designing a typeface, while this is a 'rebranding' exercise.
